titleStmt.title: Thomas W. Allen et al., Affidavit
CWG2725

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p: We Thomas W. Allen D. S for G.B. Grundy sheriff of McCracken County, J. E. Lennon D. S for R. S. Boyd sheriff of Livingston County, Thompson Prince D. S. for J. T. Young sheriff of Lyon County and J. C. Barnes D. S. for J. M. Harper sheriff of Caldwell County duly authorized to compare the certificates of the examining boards of the above named counties do certify that at an election held in said counties on the 5th day of March 1862 Thomas A. Duke was duly elected to fill the office of Senator in place of John M. Johnson expelled.
Given under our hands this 10th day of March 1862.

Thos W Allen D. S.
for George. B. Grundy Sheriff Mc.C
W. P. Prince D S
for J. P. Young S. L. C
J E Lennon DS for
R S Boyd S L C
J. C. Barnes D. S.
for J. M. Harper S. C. C.

Thos. A. Duke
Senator in place of Jno. M. Johnson
Filed Mar 17 1862
